item.title: 中国电动汽车热潮有可能将汽油需求推下悬崖
item.description: 从环绕北京故宫的古巷中的特斯拉充电桩，到西部沙漠中设有充电桩的孤独的高速公路休息站，中国交通运输电气化和汽油消亡的迹象随处可见。【原文：From Tesla chargers in the ancient alleys that surround the Forbidden City in Beijing to lonely highway rest stops with charging posts in the western deserts, signs of the electrification of China’s transport fleet — and the demise of gasoline — are everywhere.】

item.title: 中国新疆崛起为煤炭枢纽有损气候目标
item.description: 新疆西部地区正在成为中国煤炭生产的第四个枢纽，就在中国试图开始摆脱这种污染严重的燃料时，它创造了一个新的降价供应井。【原文：The western region of Xinjiang is emerging as a fourth hub for Chinese coal production, creating a new well of cut-price supply just as the country tries to start weaning itself off the heavily polluting fuel.】

item.title: 纳米比亚称欧盟倡议延迟影响绿色债券发行
item.description: 由于欧盟为帮助发展中市场发行债券而提出的一项倡议受挫，纳米比亚出售绿色债券以资助可再生能源和氢能项目的计划被推迟。【原文：Namibia’s plans to sell green bonds to fund renewable energy and hydrogen projects have been delayed due to setbacks with a European Union initiative established to help developing markets with issuances.】

item.title: 感恩节风暴将在错误的时间为纽约带来所需的雨水
item.description: 纽约将迎来一个潮湿的感恩节，因为一场快速移动的风暴给东北部带来了急需的湿气，这可能会使旅行计划复杂化，并给梅西著名的节日游行带来降雨。【原文：New York is in for a wet Thanksgiving, as a fast-moving storm brings the Northeast badly needed moisture that could complicate travel plans and rain on Macy’s famed holiday parade.】

item.title: 特朗普执政期间，美国各州市能为气候做些什么？丰富
item.description:
联邦在气候问题上的进展可能会停滞不前，但市政厅和各州议会正处于巩固近期成果的有利位置。【原文：

Federal progress on climate may stall, but city halls and statehouses are in a good position to build on recent gains. 

】

item.title: SolarEdge 减记 10 亿美元后裁员 12
item.description: SolarEdge Technologies 公司将解雇约 12% 的员工，并关闭其能源存储部门，因为美国市场不景气，促使该制造商本月减记了 10 亿美元。【原文：SolarEdge Technologies Inc. is firing about 12% of its staff and closing its energy-storage unit amid a slump in the US market that prompted the manufacturer to take a $1 billion writedown this month.】

item.title: 贝莱德和先锋集团被德克萨斯州指控违反反垄断法
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.）、先锋集团（Vanguard Group Inc.【原文：BlackRock Inc., Vanguard Group Inc. and State Street Corp. were sued by a group of states led by Texas for allegedly breaking antitrust law by boosting electricity prices through their investments, in the highest-profile lawsuit yet against the beleaguered ESG industry.】

item.title: Netflix 的 "立即购买！"展示了全球购物盛宴的代价
item.description:
导演尼克-斯泰西（Nic Stacey）在他的新纪录片中探讨了网络零售的兴起如何加剧了过度消费。【原文：

Director Nic Stacey explores how the rise of online retail has exacerbated overconsumption in his new documentary. 

】

item.title: 首尔遭遇 100 多年来最大降雪造成混乱
item.description: 本周三，韩国首都首尔迎来了本季度的第一场雪，降雪量达到创纪录的 17.2 厘米，导致交通堵塞，部分航班停飞，气象局预报将出现更多恶劣天气。【原文：The first snowfall of the season dumped a record 17.2 centimeters of snow in South Korea’s capital city Seoul on Wednesday, snarling traffic, grounding some flights with the weather bureau forecasting more bad weather.】

item.title: 政客难逃洪水侵袭
item.description:
正如最近英国和西班牙的极端天气所表明的那样，领导人无法躲避全球变暖，而那些试图躲避全球变暖的人则可能会受到影响。【原文：

As recent extreme weather in the UK and Spain has shown, leaders can’t hide from global warming — and there are potential repercussions for those who try to.

】

item.title: 欧洲将迎来乌克兰战争以来最寒冷的冬季，带来能源风险
item.description: 欧洲将迎来自俄罗斯入侵乌克兰以来最寒冷的冬天，由于欧洲大陆以比往常更快的速度动用天然气储备，从而推高了能源成本。【原文：Europe is set for the coldest winter since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, pushing up energy costs as the continent dips into its gas reserves at a faster-than-usual rate.】

item.title: 中国太阳能出口商为结束 "不公平 "竞争而战
item.description: 中国太阳能出口商承诺停止在海外市场相互压价，转而参与 "良性竞争"，因为该行业正处于供应过剩和价格战的煎熬之中。【原文：Chinese solar exporters pledged to stop undercutting each other’s prices in overseas markets and engage instead in “healthy competition”, as the sector languishes on a supply glut and price war.】

item.title: 不丹研究为 230 亿美元水电计划提供绿色融资
item.description: 不丹正在研究利用混合融资和绿色债券为潜在的 225 亿美元水力发电能力建设提供资金的计划，因为这个喜马拉雅国家正寻求重振其陷入困境的经济。【原文：Bhutan is studying plans to fund a potential $22.5 billion buildout of hydropower generation capacity with a mix of blended finance and green bonds, as the Himalayan nation seeks to revive its floundering economy.】

item.title: 澳大利亚称有望实现 2030 年减排目标
item.description: 澳大利亚政府表示，尽管此前有人担心全国可再生能源推广速度不够快，无法实现法定目标，但澳大利亚有望在 2030 年之前实现减排目标。【原文：Australia’s government said it is on track to meet its emissions cut targets by 2030, despite earlier concerns that the renewable energy rollout across the country wasn’t moving fast enough to meet the legislated goals.】

item.title: NTPC Green 12 亿美元上市测试可再生能源需求
item.description: 印度顶级电力生产商 NTPC Ltd. 旗下可再生能源部门的股票在发行 12 亿美元后将于周三开始交易，这将考验投资者对年底前最大上市之一的胃口。【原文：Shares of the renewable-energy arm of top Indian power producer NTPC Ltd. are set to start trading Wednesday after a $1.2 billion offering, testing investor appetite for one of the biggest listings before the year-end.】

item.title: 中国气候专家对提前达到排放峰值更有信心
item.description: 由于新清洁能源项目的大量涌现，中国气候专家对中国提前数年达到 2030 年碳排放峰值的目标越来越有信心。【原文：Chinese climate experts have grown more confident the nation will peak carbon emissions years ahead of the government’s 2030 target due to a flood of new clean energy projects.】

item.title: 贝莱德支持的新西兰太阳能公司停止运营
item.description: 新西兰贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：SolarZero, a New Zealand company owned by BlackRock Inc. that supports solar panel installations on residential homes, has been placed into liquidation.】

item.title: 120 亿美元气候基金准备发行罕见债券
item.description: 由于各国政府不愿提供削减全球排放量所需的额外资金，一个多边气候基金正准备首次进入资本市场。【原文：A multilateral climate fund is preparing to access capital markets for the first time, as governments balk at providing the extra financing needed to cut global emissions.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜后，道达尔暂停纽约海上风电场计划
item.description: 由于美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普誓言要阻挠其前任倡导的绿色产业，道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）已停止开发其计划在纽约海岸建造的海上风电场。【原文：TotalEnergies SE has halted the development of an offshore wind farm it plans to build off the coast of New York, as US President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to obstruct the green industry championed by his predecessor.】

item.title: 智利能源部长愿意推迟有争议的定价改革
item.description: 智利政府愿意撤销一项会侵蚀可再生能源行业部分利润的措施，但承诺日后将重新审查针对小型发电企业的规定。【原文：Chile’s government is willing to withdraw a measure that would have eaten into profits for a segment of the renewable energy industry, but is pledging to review the rules for small electricity generators at a later date.】

item.title: 斯特兰蒂斯计划因电动车任务而关闭英国面包车工厂
item.description: Stellantis NV 公司计划关闭位于英国卢顿的一家面包车工厂，以示对政府强制增加电动汽车销售的斥责。【原文：Stellantis NV plans to close a van factory in Luton, England, in a rebuke of the government mandating more electric vehicle sales.】

item.title: 特朗普和人工智能发电热潮正危及公用事业的气候目标
item.description:
一些美国公用事业公司表示，数据中心需求的不断增长意味着化石燃料的需求时间将更长

。【原文：

Some US utilities say rising demand from data centers means fossil fuels will be needed for longer

】

item.title: COP29 最后一刻达成的 3000 亿美元协议是一个烂摊子，也是一个奇迹
item.description:
丹麦首相梅特-弗雷德里克森（Mette Frederiksen）在本周的Zero节目中说："目标和指标是一回事，但实现目标是下一件事。【原文：

“Goals and targets are one thing, but delivering is the next thing,” Mette Frederiksen, prime minister of Denmark, says on this week’s Zero. 

】

item.title: 阿联酋首次考虑欧盟式处罚污染者计划
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国正在考虑引入污染收费机制，这将巩固其在应对气候变化方面的地区领导者地位。【原文：The United Arab Emirates is weighing the introduction of a pollution-charging mechanism, which would cement its position as a regional leader in the fight against climate change.】

item.title: 衰退的美国海上风电产业将新一代初创企业送往海外
item.description:
虽然 Aikido Technologies 刚刚在美国水域部署了首个浮动平台，但那里的市场似乎越来越不受欢迎。【原文：

Though Aikido Technologies has just deployed its first floating platform in US waters, the market there appears increasingly unappealing.

】

item.title: 主权债务为绿色投资者带来困境
item.description:
64万亿美元的全球市场在很大程度上不欢迎注重可持续发展的投资，但也难以避免。【原文：

The $64 trillion global market is largely inhospitable to sustainability-minded investing, but also hard to avoid.

】

item.title: 丹麦中央银行称部分贷款人面临二氧化碳税风险
item.description: 丹麦哥本哈根中央银行表示，丹麦对农业排放征税的计划将导致该国部分金融机构的减值费用上升，但不会威胁金融稳定。【原文：Denmark’s plan to tax agriculture emissions will lead to rising impairment charges for some of the nation’s financial institutions but won’t threaten financial stability, the central bank in Copenhagen said.】

item.title: 据说 TPG 正在就收购西门子歌美飒印度资产进行深入谈判
item.description: 据知情人士透露，TPG 公司正在就收购西门子能源公司 Gamesa 部门的印度风能资产进行深入谈判。【原文：TPG Inc. is in advanced talks to buy the Indian wind energy assets of Siemens Energy AG’s Gamesa unit, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 研究发现：富裕国家无法为气候厄运提供避风港
item.description: 随着关注气候变化的主权债务投资者对各国应对全球气温上升的措施进行仔细审查，他们越来越多地发现，较富裕的国家并没有为解决全球变暖问题尽自己的一份力量。【原文：As sovereign debt investors concerned about climate change scrutinize national responses to rising global temperatures, they’re increasingly finding that wealthier nations aren’t doing their part to help address global warming.】

item.title: 拜登为谷物带输电线路提供 49 亿美元融资
item.description: 拜登政府正在为横跨堪萨斯州至密苏里州的高压输电线路项目提供 49 亿美元的有条件贷款担保。【原文：The Biden administration is offering a $4.9 billion conditional loan guarantee for a high-voltage transmission line project spanning Kansas to Missouri.】
